item.title: How I replaced animation with shader and ̶s̶a̶v̶e̶d̶ optimized the world
item.description:
So one fine day our designer decided that the trees in Summer Catchers are boring. And he was actually right because they were totally static.
After full day of work he presented a brand new version of tree crowns which were steadily swaying in the light wind. A real breath of fresh air in the visual aesthetics of the game.

But then I checked how this was achieved. My breath was taken away.

item.title: How I made logos crisper, while also minimizing a memory footprint and a build size
item.description: Minimizing the build size of your game is always a plus: it saves your disk space, it saves your time to upload and your players’ time to download, besides some app stores and shops impose size limits. So that’s one of the things which I was doing while porting our game to Nintendo Switch (it’s worth nothing that this optimization and improvement is applicable to other platforms as well).
